page.title: 07CHANGES IN CHARLTON
page.content: The two ladies used to get all their household shopping from the tradesmen who called regularly.The grocer,baker, butcher,milkman,fishmonger,paraffin seller and ironmonger all called.Now there is just a milk delivery three times a week and a travelling shop that comes once a week.The post is delivered daily and there is a weekly refuse collection.The ladies said that shopping was no longer a pleasure.They find supermarkets very impersonal. From the neighbouring village,Creech Heathfield,there is a twice weekly shoppers' bus to,and from,Taunton's hypermarket.The service is welcomed but elderly villagers felt that the timing of the buses left them rather rushed. Within the last five years Charlton has had new water mains and has been put onto a North Sea gas supply.
